It is like a person wandering in a vast wilderness, a treacherous and dense forest, suddenly encountering an old path, an old route, an old way that has been traveled, an ancient path that people of the past have traversed.
They then follow the path.
Having followed it, they see an old city, an ancient capital, with gardens, forests, and ponds complete, with pure and delightful streets.
Having seen it, that person thinks like this:
'I should now quickly go to the king and inform him of this matter.
At that time, that person went to the king and said:
'Great King, you should know!
I was wandering in the wilderness, marshes, and thick forests, and suddenly encountered an old road, an old path, an old place of travel, and an ancient road that people of old had traveled on.
I followed it.
Having followed it, I saw an old city, an ancient royal capital, with gardens, forests, and ponds all complete, with clean and wonderful streets that were very delightful.
Great King!
If you now build a city there, it will surely make the Great King prosper, be vast, peaceful, prosperous, and joyful, with a flourishing population.'
At that time, the king then built a city there.
Later, the king's capital prospered, was vast, peaceful, prosperous, and joyful, with a flourishing population.
I am also like this.
I have now realized the old path, the old track, the old place of travel, and the ancient road that ancient sages had traveled on.
What is called the old path, the old road, the old route, the old trail that ancient sages have traveled?

You should know that it is the eightfold noble path, namely, right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration, up to the eighth.
This is called the old path, the old road, the old route, the old trail that ancient sages have traveled.
I have previously followed this path.
Having followed it, I have seen old age and death, seen the arising of old age and death, seen the cessation of old age and death, and seen the path leading to the cessation of old age and death.

In this way, I have seen birth, existence, grasping, craving, feeling, contact, the six sense bases, name and form, consciousness, and volitional formations, seen the arising of volitional formations, seen the cessation of volitional formations, and seen the path leading to the cessation of volitional formations.
I have naturally attained insight into this Dharma.
